elements.title: Rubric
elements.text:
The church year begins with first Sunday in Advent. There are three set of readings to be rotated in this order: A; B and C. readings.
First Sunday in Advent (Purple)
Isaiah 62:10-12 (b) Isaiah 42:1-9 (c) Isaiah 2:2-5

Lutheran Day (First Sunday of October)
Jeremiah 1:4-12
Romans 10:1-15
Matthew 28:18-20
The Epiphany day is the 6th of January, when it falls on ordinary day, we do not gather for worship, except on Sunday. On both Maundy Thursday and Ascension Day, we do gather for worship in the evening around 4 pm, and we follow the order of Sunday Service. On Good Friday we do gather for worship in the morning as we use to come for Sunday morning worship. All Saints Day is the first Sunday in November. October 31st is Reformation Day, and may fall on any other day other than Sunday. When it is not on Sunday, we should assemble for worship in the evening using the order of Sunday service.
The Sacrament of Holy Baptism
